results.title: The Door
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Anne Pratten, Jo-Anne McGowan and Josie Keys
results.brief_description: A bedroom door becomes the focus of a teenage girl’s battle with her insensitive stepfather to reclaim the simpler relationship she remembers sharing with her mother. Stars Barry Otto and Penne Hackforth-Jones. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS

results.title: Deadly Treadlies: out bush
results.brief_description:
Deadly Treadlies is a bike-rebuilding project that has operated out of Alice Springs, in local town camps and in remote Aboriginal communities since January 2003. The project was initiated in response to young people identifying bikes as a popular alternative to petrol sniffing and other substance and solvent abuse. The project has worked with over 500 young people since its inception in local town camps, schools, drop-in centres and on remote communities. In conjunction with the bike building, a series of video workshops were run and Deadly Treadlies uses footage taken by young people from Santa Teresa, Papunya and Titjikala communities.
More info at http://www.asyass.org.au

results.title: Going Solo
results.brief_description:
Through life experiences such as divorce, bereavement or never meeting the right soulmate we may find ourselves fifty plus and living on our own. For some in this situation a new partner is not what they crave, just the supportive friendship of those who understand.

Based on a series of interviews conducted with members of a Catholic Women’s solo group, this 36 min amateur documentary is a first time effort for the filmmaker and although the production values are at times questionable - the heart and soul of the women interviewed shine through making this a warm, often funny and inspirational account of life for a growing number of people in our community.
